intro: Cacalia disticha, commonly known as the two-branched bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Cacalia disticha is often found in alpine and coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
